channel.title: Modules on Provision cloud resources using Kubernetes CRDs & Terraform
channel.description: Recent content in Modules on Provision cloud resources using Kubernetes CRDs & Terraform

item.title: Modules
item.description: Modules This guide will show you how to provision an AWS RDS module using Kubeform. Examples used in this guide can be found here. Look at the Terraform configuration below: { "module": { "test-rds": { "source": "terraform-aws-modules/rds/aws", "allocated_storage": "5", "backup_window": "03:00-04:00", "engine": "mysql", "engine_version": "5.7.19", "family": "mysql5.7", "identifier": "demodb", "instance_class": "db.t2.large", "maintenance_window": "Mon:00:00-Mon:03:00", "major_engine_version": "5.7", "name": "demodb", "options": [ { "option_name": "MARIADB_AUDIT_PLUGIN", "option_settings": [ { "name": "SERVER_AUDIT_EVENTS", "value": "CONNECT" }, { "name": "SERVER_AUDIT_FILE_ROTATIONS", "value": "37" } ] } ], "parameters": [ { "name": "character_set_client", "value": "utf8" }, { "name": "character_set_server", "value": "utf8" } ], "password": "foobar1234", "port": "3306", "skip_final_snapshot": true, "subnet_ids": [ "<subnet id>" ], "tags": { "Environment": "dev", "Owner": "user" }, "username": "user", "vpc_security_group_ids": [ "<vpc id>" ] } } } This config creates an AWS RDS instance.
